On x PAF:
The future of trail running

Dear all, in case you haven't noticed, but RUNNING is bigger than ever. By running, we mean jogging and preferably with like-minded people. There is no city left where there is at least one serious running club. The good thing about performance running wear is that it can also be used for other purposes. In other words, this type of clothing and footwear is multifunctional and can also be worn without a competitive character. One brand that utilizes the multifunctionality of its products like no other is On Running, which has been known simply as ON since this year. This is the second time the Swiss sportswear giant ON has teamed up with the avant-garde design collective POST ARCHIVE FACTION - PAF from Seoul. Following the success of the first collaboration, Current Form 1.0, which focussed on road running and warm weather conditions, the second edition, Current Form 2.0, focuses on trail running and challenging outdoor conditions - from roads to trails, from sun to snow.

The new collection once again perfectly emphasizes the synergy between functionality and design. The trail running shoes in the range, such as the new Cloudventure Peak, stand out in particular. This shoe combines robust durability with a futuristic look that is ideal for running on challenging terrain. The weight of 220 grams is light as a feather for a trail-running sneaker. Other features include an asymmetric lacing system, a Lotus-inspired construction, and, of course, a sole packed with performance technology.

The second On sneaker from the collection with PAF is the well-known Cloudmonster 2, which combines elegance with functionality. The PAF x On Running Cloudmonster 2 is a running shoe for the road. This model is also relatively light at 266 grams. The Zurich river Limmat inspired the lines and shape. The sole features the largest Cloud technology ever and the model has been given an even more futuristic look.Â
